alert.note: Alert for Burt (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 02 at 7:17AM CDT until August 02 at 10:15AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: The National Weather Service in Omaha/Valley has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Harrison County in southwestern Iowa... Southeastern Burt County in east central Nebraska... * Until 1015 AM CDT. * At 717 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tekamah, Pisgah, Little Sioux, Pelican Point State Recreation Area and Willow Lake Recreation Area. Avoid driving within the flash flood area, especially around Tekamah and Little Sioux areas. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
